text: Climate change is a hoax to sell solar panels and gluten-free kale. ☀️🥬
explanation: False. Climate change is supported by decades of scientific data and observations.

text: Electric cars pollute more than gas cars because of battery magic or something. ⚡🚗💨
explanation: False. EVs have higher production emissions, but lower lifetime emissions overall.

text: If we all just use paper straws, the oceans will be fine. Problem solved. 🥤🌊
explanation: False. Personal changes help, but major pollution comes from industrial and systemic sources.

text: Recycling symbols mean it’s recyclable. Always. That’s the whole point. ♻️✅
explanation: Not necessarily. Many products are labeled with misleading recycling symbols but aren't actually recyclable in most systems.

text: Wind turbines cause cancer. It’s the spinning. Look it up. 🌬️🧬
explanation: There is no evidence linking wind turbines to cancer. This claim has been thoroughly debunked.

text: Recycling isn't a scam—but it's also not the magic solution we were promised. ♻️🫠
explanation: Correct. Recycling helps, but systemic change and reduction are more effective.

text: The hottest years on record? Almost all of them happened in the last decade. 🔥📈
explanation: True. Global temperatures have broken records repeatedly over the past decade.

text: Trees talk to each other underground using fungi. Nature has Wi-Fi. 🌳🍄
explanation: True. Mycorrhizal networks allow trees to share nutrients and signals through fungal roots.

text: Plastic doesn’t biodegrade—it just breaks into smaller plastic forever. Micro forever. 🧴🫧
explanation: True. Plastic breaks down into microplastics, which persist in the environment indefinitely.

text: Climate change isn't just about polar bears. It messes with food, water, weather, everything. 🐻‍❄️🌾
explanation: Yes. Climate change affects agriculture, sea levels, storms, and more—not just Arctic wildlife.
